intro: Centaurium beyrichii var. glanduliferum, commonly known as the glandular centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite and often covered with glandular dots, giving it its specific epithet. The flowers are usually pink to reddish in color and bloom from late spring to early summer.
